intro: Roldana mezquitalana, commonly known as the Mezquitalana roldana, is a rare and endemic plant species found primarily in the Sierra Madre Occidental region of Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and fibrous roots. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its flowering period occurs during the spring and early summer, producing small, yellowish to white flowers. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
